newsitem.title: USA: Vitalink to buy GranCare pharmacy unit for $370 mln.
newsitem.headline: Vitalink to buy GranCare pharmacy unit for $370 mln.

text.p: Vitalink Pharmacy Services Inc. said Wednesday it will acquire GranCare Inc.'s institutional pharmacy business -- TeamCare -- in a $370 million deal that would create a giant provider of drugs to the nursing home industry.
Vitalink is an 82 percent-owned unit of Manor Care Inc., which owns 180 nursing homes throughout the country.
Following the merger, Vitalink will serve 166,000 beds, or 10 percent of the nation's nursing homes, through 54 pharmacies in 29 states, the company said.
"We expect to realise significant operating savings through purchasing leverage and the elimination of duplicate functions in our organisations," said Donna DeNardo, Vitalink president.
Under the agreement, Stewart Bainum Jr, chairman of Manor Care, will become chairman of Vitalink and Gene Burleson, GranCare chairman, will be Vitalink's chief executive officer.
"Our expanded customer base and geographic presence will allow us to capture a greater share of the growing subacute nursing and assisted living facilities markets," said Burleson.
The transaction has already been approved by the board of each company but is still subject to approval of GranCare's stockholders.
The transaction is expected to be completed before the end of the year.
Grancare's stock jumped $2.50 to $20.25 in early trading on the New York Stock Exchange, while Manor Care was off 50 cents at $34. Vitalink was unchanged at $23 on the Nasdaq market.
